definition.en: The accessibility characteristics of an entity used by passengers such as a Stop Place.
Describes the usability of an entity for passengers with certain needs.
A jurisdictional geographic boundary.
Physical entrance or exit to/from a Site.

usage.en: May be a door, barrier, gate or other recognisable point of access.

definition.en: A set of Entities grouped together according to a purpose of grouping, e.g. grouping of stops known to the public by a common name.
A grouping of Stop Places which will be commonly referenced for a specific purpose (stops inside an airport, main stops of a city, etc.).
An identified storey (ground, first, basement, mezzanine, etc) within an interchange building or Site on which Site Components reside.
Parameters and properties to be used when processing and presenting data in a country or region (time zone, language, etc.).
A company providing public transport services.
The allocation of a Scheduled Stop Point  to a Stop Place.
Topographically significant location that a transport model may wish to describe.
A 0-dimensional node of the Network used for the spatial description of the Network. Points may be located by a Location in a given Locating System.
A type of Place to or through which passengers may wish to navigate as part of their journey and which is modelled in detail by route planners.
Defines a uniform set of values to control appearances of an element (on a map, a schematic map, a paper or screen description, etc.).
A  place such as a platform, bus stop, stance or quay side where passengers have access to public transport vehicles, taxi, cars or other means of transportation.
A Point where passengers can board or alight from vehicles.

usage.en: More details on this class in the application profile NETEX Belgium - Timetables.

definition.en: A type of Place,such as a Stop Place,Point of Interest or Address,to which passengers may wish to travel.
A component of a Site describing a part of its structure. Shares common properties for equipment, management, accessibility and other features.
A Stop Place represents a station, stop, port, airport or any physical point of access to the transport network.
Physical entrance or exit to/from a Stop Place for a passenger.
Space that is part of a Stop Place, like a Quay or a Stop Place Entrance.
A Zone used to define a zonal fare structure.
A Point against which the timing information necessary to build schedules may be recorded.
A geographical settlement which provides topographical context when searching for or presenting travel information, for example as the origin or destination of a trip.
Relative weight of the Stop Place with respect to interchange possibilities.
UIC code of the Country.
Categorisation of the Topographic Place.
Time zone of the Locale as offset in hours from GMT.

usage.en: Can be plus, or minus. May be decimal for fractional differences.

definition.en: Name of the time zone associated with the Locale.
Font of the tekst.
Colour value to use forthe  text of an entity in the user interface.

usage.en: Eg he colour of the name of a Line.

definition.en: Time zone as an offset in hours or part hours from GMT.

usage.en: Can be plus or minus.

definition.en: Type of possible Interchange at the Stop Place.

usage.en: Useful for route planners.

definition.en: The type of Stop Place.
Stop place.
Topographic Place served by the Stop Place.
Point of Interest served by the Stop Place.
Address of a numbered building on a named road.
Classification of the Quay.
Reference to a Quay within the Stop Place to which the Scheduled Stop Point is assigned.
Indicates whether the Level is for public use.
Primary Transport Mode of the Operator.
Postcode or partial postcode associated with the Topographic Place.
A postal address to which mail can be sent.
Polygon describing the spatial extent of the Stop Place.
Polygon associated with the Point of Interest.
Polygon associated with the Topographic Place.
Polygon associated with the Zone
Asset code used to identify the Quay.
Categorisation of Place.
Reference to a parent Topographic Place that contains the Topographic Place.
Parent Site which contains this Stop Place.
Parent Site which contains the Point of Interest.
Reference to parent of Quay that wholly contains it.

usage.en: This allows to represent composite platforms with two or more sides or named sections. Allows routeplanning to a higher level of detail.

definition.en: Other transportmode available at the Stop Place.
For Topographic Places that span borders, references to additional Country or Countries that Place lies in.
Reference to the Operator of the Stop Place.
Reference to the Operator of the Point of Interest.
Topographic Places near the Point of Interest.
Stop Place which is the main terminus of the Topographic Place.
Country where the Stop Place is located.
Locale setting the time zone, default language, etc., for the Stop Place.
Locale setting time zone, default language, etc., for the Point of Interest.
Indicates how well the Stop Place is lit.
Indicates how the Quay is lit.
Indicates how the Entrance is lit.
Other languages supported in the Locale.
Name of a nearby landmark.

usage.en: Mainly relevant for bus modes.

definition.en: Name of a nearby Landmark.
ISO code for the Topographic Place.
Indicates whether the Site Entrance opens externally.
Indicates whether the Entrance can be used for exit from the Stop Place.
Indicates whether the Entrance can be used for entry to the Stop Place.
URL of an image associated with the entity.

usage.en: Eg an icon.

definition.en: Image of the Stop Place.
Indicates whether the Stop Place is within a gated area.
Indicates whether the Quay is within a gated area.
Indicates whether the Entrance is within a gated area.
Topographic Place for which the Stop Place is the main terminus.
Type of Site Entrance.
Entrance to the Point of Interest.
Entrance from the Stop Place.
Indicates whether there is a drobbed kerb outside the Site Entrance.
Default language of the Locale, e.g. en, fr, de, etc.
Name of nearest cross road or crossing street which can be used to locate the Stop Place.

usage.en: Mainly relevant for bus modes, where the cross road may provide necessary context to describe the stop to a user.

definition.en: Name of nearest cross road or crossing street which can be used to locate the Quay.

usage.en: Mainly relevant for bus modes, where the cross road may provide necessary context to describe the stop to a user.

definition.en: Name of nearest cross road or crossing street on which site is and which can be used to locate the Entrance.

usage.en: Mainly relevant for bus modes, where the cross road may provide necessary context to describe the stop to a user.

definition.en: Indicates whether the Stop Place is covered or outdoors.
Indicates whether the Quay is covered.
Indicates whether the Entrance is covered of outdoors.
The platforms in the stopping area, that is, platforms, jetties, bays, taxi ranks and other points of physical vehicle access.
Reference to other Topographic Places within which the Topographic Place is contained.
Stop Place located in the Topographic Place.
Bearing of street relative to Quay in degrees (absolute bearing of front part of Vehicle when stopped at Quay).
RGB colour value to use for an entity in the user interface.

usage.en: Eg the colour of a Line.

definition.en: Classification of the Point of Interest.
Centre Point of the Stop Place.
Centre Point of the Topographic Place.
Centre Point of the Topographic Place.
Centre Point of the Zone.
Default RGB background colour value for graphics associated with an entity.
Indicates whether all areas of the Level are wheelchair accessible.
Type of usability.

usage.en: Eg accessible by wheelchair, escalator free access etc.

definition.en: Reference to an AccessibilityLimitation making up the AccessibilityAssessment.
Level of usability.
Access modes by which the Stop Place may be accessed.
Access mode of the Quay.
Access modes of the Entrance.
Stop Place serving the Topographic Place.
Country where the Topographic Place is situated.
Presentation features of the TariffZone.

usage.en: Such as the colour associated with the zone.

definition.en: Label of the Quay.
The main transport mode of the Stop Place.
Tariff zone associated with the Stop Place.
Subordinate transport mode in the Stop place.
Scheduled Stop Point associated with the Stop Place.
Code used to identify a Stop Place to the public as an alternative to a name.
Topographic Place in which the Stop Place is located.
Indicates whether the Stop Place is a border crossing.
The overall accessibility characteristics of the Stop Place.
Accessibility of the Quay.
Accessibility of the Entrance.
Level of the Quay.
Level of the Entrance.
Floor of the Stop Place.
Code use to identify the Quay to the public.
Point of Interest served by the Stop Place.
Level of the Point of Interest.
Referentie naar verbonden klasse.
Referentie naar verbonden klasse.
Reference to the Country.
Short name for the Level.
Public code of the Level.
Accessibility of the Level.
Transport mode of the Group of Stop Places.
Submode of the Group of Stop Places
Stop Place that belongs to the Group of Stop Places.
List of Points within the Topographic Place.
List of Points within the Group of Points.
Short name of the Stop Place.
Short name for the Group of Stop Places.
Short name of the Point of Interest.
Purpose of grouping the Stop Places.
Private code of the Stop Place.
Private code associated with the Group of Stop Places.
Private code of the Point of Interest.
Width of the Entrance.
Public code for the Site Entrance.
Label of the Entrance.
Height of the Entrance.
Default URL for the Stop Place.
Two-dimensional place within the service area of a public transport operator.

usage.en: Eg an administrative zone,tariff zone,access zone etc.

definition.en: Information such as email, telephone, address that allows to contact someone or something.

usage.en: Eg a person or organization or service... Possible forms of contact: calling, emailing, etc.

definition.en: Information about the opening hours of the place or service.

A 0-dimensional geometric object that represents a particular location in a coordinate space. Has an x coordinate and a y coordinate. Can also have a z coordinate (height) and an m coordinate (distance along a curve).
Surface consisting of 1 outer boundary and 0 or more inner boundaries. Each inner boundary forms a hole in the polygon.

usage.en: The boundaries are so-called LinearRings, ie they are closed (not self-intersecting) LineStrings. The outer boundary is distinguished from the inner boundary by the clockwise and counterclockwise direction of the ring, respectively.

definition.en: Subset of real numbers represented in decimal notation.
Code denoting a natural language.

TODO
TODO
TODO
TODO
Type of Organization.
Information used to uniquely identify an object.

usage.en: The basic principle here is that this string is assigned by an organization and that this is done according to a well-defined system.

definition.en: More readable representation of a structured Address with only the basic or combined data, intended for the use of an address as an attribute of another object or as a label.

usage.en: Eg as an attribute of a person or building or as a label on a letter or a map.

definition.en: Shape and position characteristics of an object.

usage.en: Describes these features using points, lines, polygons, and coordinates.

definition.en: A recognized organization, recognized in a broad sense or more specifically in a legal sense, with associated rights and obligations.

usage.en: Eg a company, a non-profit organization, a government body, a church community.

definition.en: A number of people organized into a community or other social, commercial, or political structure. The group has a common purpose or raison d'être that transcends its individual members and it can act as an agent. An organization often has a hierarchical structure.

usage.en: More details on this class in the W3C Organization Ontology.

definition.en: Organization with a legal status established by registration. This is more specific than a Formal Organization where this status can also be obtained in another way.

usage.en: In Belgium, like in many other countries, the following kinds Organizations must register: company, sole proprietorship, government body, foundation Upon registration, the Organization receives a company number and its details are entered in a central registry called Crossrads Bank for Enterprises (CBE). More details on this class in the Registered Organization Vocabulary.

definition.en: Information that makes it possible to refer in a structured and unique way to a building unit, a berth, a location or a plot on the basis of a municipality name, a street name, a house number and possibly a bus number and a postal code.

usage.en: The definition refers to Belgian Addresses. In other countries, an Address may refer to other geographical objects (not a building unit or parcel) or may consist of other designations (different from house number and bus number) or of components other than street name, municipality name or postal code. Foreign addresses can be exchanged using the Address Representation object. More detail on this class in the INSPRE Address specification.

definition.en: Indication of a quantity.

usage.en: In practice the primitive data types with which a quantity can be indicated, see xsd data types Float, Double, Decimal, Integer etc.

definition.en: Indication of the quantity of a particular characteristic of an object.

usage.en: For example, the height of an object, the weight, the temperature, etc. It concerns a characteristic that can be expressed numerically and in a certain unit. Qualitative indications such as high, low, etc. are therefore not included.

definition.en: Unit established by a standardizing organization.

usage.en: Datatype can be a URI or a TypedString. In the first case, reference is made to units published on the web, preferably those from qudt, eg http://qudt.org/vocab/unit/M for meter. In the case of a TypedString, preference is given to the UCUM codes, eg "km/h"^^http://w3id.org/lindt/custom_datatypes#ucumunit.

definition.en: Number by which the quantity of the characteristic can be expressed.
The unit in which the value is expressed

usage.en: To be used if no standard unit is known.

definition.en: The standardized unit in which the value is expressed.
Name of the adminstrative unit of the Address.
Address from which the address representation is derived.

usage.en: This is only possible for Belgian addresses, as Address here means a Belgian Address.

definition.en: Country in which the Address is located.
Municipality name of the Address.
Alphanumeric code officially assigned to building units, berths, pitches or plots.

usage.en: Specialization of locatorIndicator intended for Belgian addresses.

definition.en: Officially assigned alphanumeric code that is added to the house number to distinguish multiple building units, pitches, berths or lots that have the same house number.

usage.en: Specialization of locatorIndicator intended for Belgian addresses.

definition.en: Website to which one can surf.
Name of, for example, the person who can be contacted.
Identifier obtained by the organization upon registration.

usage.en: In the CBE this would be the enterprisenumber.

definition.en: Type of Organization.

usage.en: Specialization of classification (besides activity & status).

definition.en: Legally registered name of the organization.

usage.en: Possibly in different languages.

definition.en: An address component that represents the name of a passage or way through from one location to another.

usage.en: A thoroughfare is not necessarily a road, it might be a waterway or some other feature.

definition.en: Name identifying the geographic area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
Code identifying the geographic area that groups addresses for postal purposes.
The Post Office Box number.
A number or a sequence of characters that uniquely identifies the location within the relevant scope.

usage.en: The full identification of the locator could include one or more locator designators. The scope is eg the street for a housenumber or the housenumber for a busnumber.

definition.en: The complete address written as a string, with or without formatting.
Postal address of the Operator.
Address that one can write to or visit.
Name of the agent who assigned the identifier.
Title by which someone is addressed or referred to.

usage.en: Eg Mr/Mrs, Excellency, Doctor...

definition.en: Name by which the organization is preferably indicated.
String used to uniquely identify the object.

usage.en: Type of the string refers to the identification system (including its version), the string itself to the actual identifier.

definition.en: Alternative name for the Stop Place.

usage.en: Used for Stops that have multiple aliases.

definition.en: Alternative name for the Country.
Alternative name for the Site Entrance.
Other name by which the organization is known.

usage.en: E.g. commercial name, informal name

definition.en: Geometry expressed in wkt format.

usage.en: Use wktLiteral as data type.

definition.en: Geometry expressed in gml format.

usage.en: Use gmlLiteral as data type..

definition.en: Date until which the specified opening hours apply.
Date from which the specified opening hours apply.
Phone number to call.
Opening hours of the place or service on the specified day of the week.
Hours within which contact can be made.

usage.en: Syntax according to schema.org for opening hours. Eg if contact can be made between 8 am and 8 pm Monday to Saturday and between 8 am and 6 pm on Sunday this will be coded as Mon-Sat 8 am-8 pm, Sun 8 am-6 pm.

definition.en: Period in which contact can be made.

usage.en: Eg indication of the season in which contact can be made. Start and end date according to ISO8601 syntax.

definition.en: Email address to which you can mail.
Day of the week for which the opening hours are valid.

usage.en: See DayOfWeek for list of possible values.

definition.en: Information such as email, telephone... that allows to contact the Organization.
Closing time of the place or service on the specified day of the week.
Time when the identifier was issued.
Description of the Stop place.
Description of the Group of Stop Places.
Description of the Level.
Description of the Point of Interest.
Description of the Organization.
Link to the agent who issued the identifier.
Name of the Stop Place.
Name of the Group of Stop Places.
Name of the Level.
Name of the Point of Interest.
Name of the Topographic Place.
Name of the Country.
Name of theEntrance.
